project_description: A simple Flutter app that toggles between displaying a Cat and a Dog when the text is clicked.
architecture_overview: The app follows the Cubit pattern for state management. The app's state is managed by Cubits, and it uses a single screen to demonstrate the functionality.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: click text
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState: new state (CatState or DogState)
AnimalCubit -> HomeScreen: state change
HomeScreen -> AnimalWidget: update display
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state of the app is managed by the AnimalCubit. When the user clicks on the text, the HomeScreen triggers the toggleAnimal method in AnimalCubit, which toggles between CatState and DogState. The state change is observed by the HomeScreen, which then updates the AnimalWidget accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app uses a single screen (HomeScreen) with no additional navigation. The HomeScreen displays the current animal and listens for state changes to update the display accordingly.
